skill.name: attack-tree-construction
skill.description: Build comprehensive attack trees to visualize threat paths. Use when mapping attack scenarios, identifying defense gaps, or communicating security risks to stakeholders.

skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and code templates only. No executable scripts, network calls, or external command usage were found.

content.user_title: Build attack trees for security planning
content.value_statement: Threat paths are hard to map and explain. This skill provides structured attack tree templates and analysis guidance for clearer risk communication.
actual_capabilities: Define OR, AND, and leaf nodes for attack trees
Assign cost, skill, time, and detection attributes to attacks
Build trees using a fluent builder pattern example
Export tree structures to JSON, Mermaid, and PlantUML text
Analyze paths to find easiest, cheapest, and stealthiest routes
limitations: Provides templates and examples, not an executable tool
Requires manual entry of nodes and attributes
Does not collect or validate real system data
No direct integration with ticketing or threat intel feeds

use_cases.title: Model system threats
use_cases.description: Create attack trees to evaluate design risks and plan defensive investments.

use_cases.title: Plan test paths
use_cases.description: Map likely attack paths to focus testing on the highest impact routes.

use_cases.title: Explain stakeholder risk
use_cases.description: Summarize attacker goals and mitigations for non technical audiences.

prompt_templates.title: Simple tree outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple attack tree for unauthorized access to a web app. Provide a root goal, two sub goals, and leaf attacks.

prompt_templates.title: Add attack attributes
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an attack tree for data exfiltration and assign difficulty, cost, detection risk, and time for each leaf.

prompt_templates.title: Mermaid diagram text
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate Mermaid flowchart text for an account takeover attack tree with OR and AND nodes.

prompt_templates.title: Mitigation priorities
prompt_templates.prompt: Given an attack tree, identify critical nodes and prioritize mitigations by coverage impact.

output_examples.input: Create an attack tree for account takeover and highlight the easiest path.
output: Root goal: Take over user account
Easiest path: Steal credentials via phishing
Top mitigations: Email filtering, security awareness training, MFA

best_practices: Start with a clear attacker goal and scope
Assign realistic attributes for each leaf attack
Review trees with experts and update regularly
anti_patterns: Building trees without assigning attack attributes
Ignoring insider and social engineering paths
Treating the tree as static once created

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: The skill is text based and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides templates and analysis logic but does not run scans or collect real data.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my tools?
faq.answer: It can export JSON, Mermaid, or PlantUML text for use in other tools.

faq.question: Does it access my data?
faq.answer: No. The content has no file or network access behaviors.

faq.question: What if the tree looks incomplete?
faq.answer: Add more sub goals, validate with experts, and iterate.

faq.question: How is this different from a full threat model?
faq.answer: It focuses on attack paths, while threat models cover assets, controls, and risks.
